name: A MDN Darkly
description: Dark style for Mozilla Developer Network (developer.mozilla.org) More themes are available via "Advanced Style Settings". The default theme is "Dark". Screenshots of themes: Imgur Album
additional_info: 2019-06-07: * Small fixes for colors / backgrounds, mostly icons. 2018-03-02: * Fixed more tables that don't play nice * Fixed other things ("bad" code blocks) * Fixed Spec labels (LivingStandard, Recommended, Draft, etc) 2018-03-01: * Update for new compatibility table (in Beta on the site). * New domain: interactive-examples.mdn.mozilla.net * Small fixes for some MDN examples. 2018-02-14: Version 0.7: * Fixed search results, and some other ugly things (warnings too yellow etc) * New theme "Tomorrow Night" (screenshot) 2018-01-19: Version 0.6: * Fixed some lighter elements (survey banner, tab backgrounds). 2018-01-06: Version 0.5: * Full rewrite with theme variables. Default: Dark theme 2017-09-26: Version 0.4: * Compensating for changes to MDN site. Should look better now! 2017-08-22: Version 0.3: * Dark background on some new elements 2017-03-05: Version 0.2: * Fixed FOUC on code blocks. * Buttons look like buttons! * Darkening even more "info" boxes with obscure classnames. * Tested on some popular Javascript/CSS/Addon sites, seems to look pretty good.

discussions.name: User Avatar should not be inverted
Please add Gitlab repo (Gitlab is opensource, Github not)
Couple of issues with the new MDN, but overall great stylesheet
Couple of issues with the new MDN, but overall great stylesheet
